text:
before 1.4 goes out, we should make sure we have a sane cache configuration by
default. if that's difficult (since caching is configured in the cocoon tree),
we should add some obvious documentation to the readme.xml

see
http://wiki.apache.org/lenya/How%20to%20tune%20Lenya%201.4%20for%20Production%20Use
creator: nettings@apache.org
thorsten@apache.org
text:
The profiler from http://localhost:8888/modules/profiling/profile.html should be
configurable:
"profiling has a very negative impact on performance and memory usage, since it
buffers all data between pipeline components. Only activate it when required,
and never activate it on production systems."
http://cocoon.apache.org/2.1/userdocs/concepts/profiler.html

(In reply to comment #1)
> The profiler from http://localhost:8888/modules/profiling/profile.html should be
> configurable:

the profile module does not do anything unless you edit a pipeline to be
type="profile-[non]caching". there was indeed one of those in
global-sitemap.xmap (probably an accidental commit), but i fixed that a few days
ago.
creator: nettings@apache.org
thorsten@apache.org
